Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of hard materials like Tungsten Carbide to remove contaminants without ablation; starting at 100-200W to balance efficiency and safety. Max limited to avoid thermal damage given WC's high melting point (~2870°C) and reflectivity at 1064 nm. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs for cleaning applications; academic review in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018) on metal cleaning thresholds.
Near-infrared wavelength for optimal Tungsten Carbide absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning resolution
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning without thermal damage
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform surface treatment
Number of cleaning passes for thorough contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for complete surface coverage
